question: Plant kingdom includes algae, _______, pteridophytes, gymnosperms and angiosperms.
Plant kingdom includes algae, bryophytes, _______, gymnosperms and angiosperms.
Plant kingdom includes algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, _______ and angiosperms.
Algae are chlorophyll-bearing simple, thalloid, autotrophic and largely _______ organisms.
Depending on the type of pigment possessed and the type of stored food, algae are classified into three classes, namely _______, Phaeophyceae and Rhodophyceae.
Depending on the type of pigment possessed and the type of stored food, algae are classified into three classes, namely Chlorophyceae, _______ and Rhodophyceae.
Depending on the type of pigment possessed and the type of stored food, algae are classified into three classes, namely Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and _______.
Algae usually reproduce vegetatively by _______.
Algae usually reproduce asexually by formation of different types of _______.
Algae usually reproduce sexually by formation of _______.
Gametes in algae may show isogamy, anisogamy or _______.
Bryophytes are plants which can live in soil but are dependent on _______ for sexual reproduction.
The bryophyte plant body is more differentiated than that of _______.
The plant body of bryophytes is thallus-like and _______ or erect.
The plant body of bryophytes is attached to the substratum by _______.
Bryophytes possess root-like, _______-like and stem-like structures.
The bryophytes are divided into liverworts and _______.
The plant body of liverworts is thalloid and _______.
Mosses have upright, slender axes bearing spirally arranged _______.
The main plant body of a bryophyte is gamete-producing and is called a _______.
The male sex organs of bryophytes are called _______.
The female sex organs of bryophytes are called _______.
The male and female gametes produced fuse to form _______.
The zygote in bryophytes produces a multicellular body called a _______.
The sporophyte produces haploid _______.
The spores of bryophytes germinate to form _______.
In pteridophytes, the main plant is a _______.
The pteridophyte sporophyte is differentiated into true root, _______ and leaves.
The organs of pteridophytes possess well-differentiated _______ tissues.
The sporophytes of pteridophytes bear sporangia which produce _______.
The spores of pteridophytes germinate to form _______.
Pteridophyte gametophytes require _______, damp places to grow.
The gametophytes of pteridophytes bear male sex organs called _______.
The gametophytes of pteridophytes bear female sex organs called _______.
In pteridophytes, water is required for transfer of male gametes to _______.
In pteridophytes, after fertilisation the zygote produces a _______.
The gymnosperms are the plants in which _______ are not enclosed by any ovary wall.
After fertilisation the seeds of gymnosperms remain exposed and therefore these plants are called _______-seeded plants.
Gymnosperms produce _______ and megaspores.
Microspores and megaspores are produced in microsporangia and _______.
Microsporangia and megasporangia are borne on the _______.
The sporophylls – microsporophylls and megasporophylls – are arranged spirally on axis to form male and female _______ respectively.
The pollen grain germinates and pollen tube releases the male gamete into the _______.
In gymnosperms, the male gamete fuses with the egg cell in _______.
Following fertilisation in gymnosperms, the zygote develops into _______.
Following fertilisation in gymnosperms, the ovules develop into _______.
The angiosperms are divided into two classes – the dicotyledons and the _______.
The angiosperms are divided into two classes – the _______ and the monocotyledons.
